Legal_Issue: Standard of review for 'membership in a particular social group' under s. 96 of IRPA
Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA), s. 96
Decision_Outcome: Respondent recognized as a refugee sur place due to potential persecution as a Sun Sea passenger
Legal_Rule: Convention refugees are defined under s. 96 IRPA as persons with a well-founded fear of persecution based on race, religion, nationality, political opinion, or membership in a particular social group
Procedural_Issue: Certified question on standard of review
Grounds_for_Claim: Well-founded fear of persecution based on membership in a particular social group (Sun Sea passengers)
Applicant_Challenge: Refugee status questioned based on association with Sun Sea passengers
Court_Result: Federal Court determined correctness applies; case remitted
Governing_Rule: Standard of review for legal questions in administrative decisions
